movies.title: Withnail & I
movies.plot: London, 1969 - two 'resting' (unemployed and unemployable) actors, Withnail and Marwood, fed up with damp, cold, piles of washing-up, mad drug dealers and psychotic Irishmen, decide to leave their squalid Camden flat for an idyllic holiday in the countryside, courtesy of Withnail's uncle Monty's country cottage. But when they get there, it rains non-stop, there's no food, and their basic survival skills turn out to be somewhat limited. Matters are not helped by the arrival of Uncle Monty, who shows an uncomfortably keen interest in Marwood...
movies.simplePlot: London, 1969 - two 'resting' (unemployed and unemployable) actors, Withnail and Marwood, fed up with damp, cold, piles of washing-up, mad drug dealers and psychotic Irishmen, decide to ...

biography.placeOfBirth: Mbabane, Union of South Africa [now Swaziland]
biography.bio: Richard E. Grant was born on May 5, 1957 in Mbabane, Union of South Africa as Richard Grant Esterhuysen. He is an actor, known for Bram Stoker's Dracula (1992), Logan (2017) and Corpse Bride (2005). He has been married to Joan Washington since November 1, 1986. They have two children.
biography.name: Richard E. Grant

biography.bio: Paul McGann was born on November 14, 1959 in Kensington, Liverpool, England. He is an actor and director, known for Alien 3 (1992), Withnail & I (1987) and Queen of the Damned (2002). He has been married to Annie Milner since 1992. They have two children.
biography.name: Paul McGann

biography.bio: British character actor Richard Griffiths came from radio and the classical stage where he built up an early reputation as a Shakespearean clown, with larger-than-life portrayals of Henry VIII, Falstaff in "The Merry Wives of Windsor" and Bottom in "A Midsummer Night's Dream" with the Royal Shakespeare Company just a few of his standout credits. The son of deaf parents, he learned sign language at an early age and, interestingly enough, developed a talent for dialects which allowed him to show off in a number of ethnic portrayals. In films from 1975 both here and abroad, his better roles have been in both contemporary and period pieces, such as Gorky Park (1983), Withnail & I (1987), King Ralph (1991), Guarding Tess (1994), Sleepy Hollow (1999) and recently the 'Harry Potter' series as Uncle Vernon Dursley. Typically cast as comic relief in serious fare, he is well known in England for a number of comedy series including Pie in the Sky (1994).
biography.name: Richard Griffiths

biography.bio: Ralph Brown was born on June 18, 1957 in Cambridge, Cambridgeshire, England. He is an actor and writer, known for Alien 3 (1992), Star Wars: Episode I - The Phantom Menace (1999) and Wayne's World 2 (1993). He is married to Jenny Jules.
biography.name: Ralph Brown

biography.bio: Michael Elphick was a fantastic and very popular actor. He will be best remembered for his role as Ken Boon in the hit series Boon (1986). He died tragically at the early age of 55. He had been in ill-health for some years, caused by a long-running battle with alcohol, which was exacerbated by the early death of his partner of many years. Best remembered for 'Boon', his career was no one-hit wonder. Elphick had been working in television for the past 33 years and his many excellent performances included Dennis Potter's Play for Today: Blue Remembered Hills (1979), as the bully, Peter; The Knowledge (1979), when he played a would-be London cab driver driven almost to despair by the sadistic examiner (played by Nigel Hawthorne); Private Schulz (1981), Auf Wiedersehen, Pet (1983) and Three Up Two Down (1985). His film career was arguably less successful, but none-the-less featured a rich and varied vein of characterisations. His final roles proved to be the film Dead in the Water (2002), in which he unfortunately had quite a small role, and millions saw his final television role, in EastEnders (1985), where he excelled in a very different role, showing just what a fine actor he was.
biography.name: Michael Elphick

biography.bio: Daragh O'Malley is a leading Irish born film, theatre and television actor. Born in Limerick, Ireland to a politician and a medical doctor O'Malley trained at the London Academy of Music and Dramatic Art . O'Malley had a theatre in the garage of his home throughout his childhood and knew from a young age acting was the only thing he wanted to do. Known for his many film and TV roles including his portrayal of Patrick Harper in the long-running [1993-2009] and iconic Sharpe TV series with Sean Bean. After a twelve-year absence from the stage O'Malley returned to UK theatre in 2012 playing Father Jack in Dancing at Lughnasa followed by playing the firebrand John Rainey in a London revival of Irvine's Mixed Marriage - a performance which Michael Billington of The Guardian called "towering" in "the most compelling play in London". At The Royal Exchange in Manchester in 2014-15 O'Malley played Big Daddy in a widely acclaimed production of Cat on a Hot Tin Roof for which he was nominated for an MTA Best Actor award.UK's The Stage selected O'Malley's performance in Cat on a Hot Tin Roof as one of the Top Five Performances in UK Theatre in 2015.
biography.name: Daragh O'Malley

biography.bio: Michael Wardle is an actor, known for Withnail & I (1987), Falling (2005) and The Black Stuff (1980).
biography.name: Michael Wardle

biography.bio: Una Brandon-Jones was born on April 24, 1916 in St Albans, Hertfordshire, England. She was an actress, known for Withnail & I (1987), Chaplin (1992) and Caravaggio (1986). She was married to John Gold. She died on December 22, 2010 in London, England.
biography.name: Una Brandon-Jones

biography.placeOfBirth: West Bromwich, West Midlands, England, UK
biography.bio: Noel Johnson was born on December 28, 1916 in West Bromwich, West Midlands, England as Noel Frank Johnson. He was an actor, known for Withnail & I (1987), For Your Eyes Only (1981) and Frenzy (1972). He died on October 2, 1999 in Glamorgan, Wales.
biography.name: Noel Johnson

biography.bio: After training at LAMDA, Irene traveled widely with the Bristol Old Vic Company, including Europe, America and the Middle East. She worked in rep at Liverpool, Leatherhead, Worthing and Wolverhampton and did seasons at Stratford-on-Avon and Chichester and toured with a Shakespearean Company. She worked with Laurence Olivier's company and appeared in Olivier's film version of "Richard the Third". In addition, she worked extensively on the West End stage, including a year in "The Mousetrap", and acted in numerous radio and television plays before joining Coronation Street (1960) in 1968.
biography.name: Irene Sutcliffe

biography.bio: Llewellyn Rees was born on June 18, 1901 in Charmouth, Dorset, England as Walter Llewellyn Rees. He was an actor, known for A Fish Called Wanda (1988), Withnail & I (1987) and The Dresser (1983). He was married to Madeleine Newbury and Carol Rees. He died on January 7, 1994 in Barnes, London, England.
biography.name: Llewellyn Rees

biography.bio: Robert Oates is an actor, known for Finding Neverland (2004), The Fifth Element (1997) and Withnail & I (1987).
biography.name: Robert Oates

biography.bio: Anthony Wise is an actor, known for Withnail & I (1987), The Magic Mile (2005) and Worst Fears (2016).
biography.name: Anthony Wise

biography.bio: Eddie Tagoe is an actor, known for Raiders of the Lost Ark (1981), Top Secret! (1984) and Withnail & I (1987).
biography.name: Eddie Tagoe

titlesAwards.titleAwardOutcome: Won Evening Standard British Film Award
